Class OrderService

java.lang.Object
com.vaadin.starter.bakery.backend.service.OrderService
All Implemented Interfaces:
CrudService<Order>
@Service public class OrderService extends Object implements CrudService<Order>
Service class for managing Order entities and related business operations.

This service provides comprehensive order management functionality including:

  • Order CRUD operations with transaction support
  • Advanced filtering and search capabilities
  • Dashboard data generation with delivery statistics
  • Order history and comment management
  • Analytics and reporting features

The service handles complex business logic for order processing, state management, and provides data for dashboard visualizations and reports.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Bakery Application

  • Method Details

    • saveOrder

      public Order saveOrder(User currentUser, Long id, BiConsumer<User,Order> orderFiller)
      Saves an order using a custom order filler function. Creates a new order if ID is null, otherwise loads and updates an existing order.
      Parameters:
      currentUser - the user performing the operation
      id - the order ID (null for new orders)
      orderFiller - function that populates the order with data
      Returns:
      the saved order

    • saveOrder

      public Order saveOrder(Order order)
      Saves an order entity to the database.
      Parameters:
      order - the order to save
      Returns:
      the saved order

    • addComment

      public Order addComment(User currentUser, Order order, String comment)
      Adds a comment to an order's history and saves the order.
      Parameters:
      currentUser - the user adding the comment
      order - the order to add the comment to
      comment - the comment text
      Returns:
      the updated order with the new history item

    • findAnyMatchingAfterDueDate

      public org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Order> findAnyMatchingAfterDueDate(Optional<String> optionalFilter, Optional<LocalDate> optionalFilterDate, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      Finds orders matching the specified criteria with due dates after the filter date. Supports optional filtering by customer name and due date.
      Parameters:
      optionalFilter - optional customer name filter
      optionalFilterDate - optional minimum due date filter
      pageable - pagination information
      Returns:
      a page of orders matching the criteria

    • findAnyMatchingStartingToday

      public List<OrderSummary> findAnyMatchingStartingToday()
      Finds order summaries for orders starting from today.
      Returns:
      list of order summaries with due dates from today onward

      Parameters:

      year - the year for which to generate data
      Returns:
